ProposalInformation.Title: NIRCam Target Acquisition for Coronagraphy (CAR NIRCam-30)
ProposalInformation.Abstract:
LRE-6-update (Sept 17 2021, J.Girard) Kept: TA = none Toggled: Astrometric Confirmation Images = No (was Yes)
SI mini-rehearsal #1 (Aug. 2020) -------------------------- There are 3 observations (19, 20, 21) for this reahearsal. See folder labeled SI-mini-1_OTB-20200817.
19 & 20 test two approaches to keeping the primary target from being occulted (for flux calibration). Obs. 21 is a normal LW bar observation w/ 2 filters.
CPR-2/3 SI Portion (Sept. 2019) ------------------------- Version 1 (J. Stansberry, 2019-08-27)
2 observations, duplicated for the SI dry-run (9/10 - 11) and SI (9/27): #13: SW Bar with astrometric confirmation images (Dry run) #14: M335R with with astrometric confirmation images and an Offset SR (Dry run) #15: SW Bar with astrometric confirmation images (Dry run) #16: M335R with with astrometric confirmation images and an Offset SR (Dry run)
Target Acq SWTS Images Required: Obs. 13 & 15: SWTS TA Image: RAPID, SUBNDASWBL, NGroups=3 Obs. 14 & 16: SWTS TA Image: BRIGHT1, SUBFSA335R, NGroups=65
SIR-1 (2018) ----------- Version 3a: --------- Updated al Target Acq exposures to use BRIGHT1 pattern. This is required due to a limitation on the SWTS, which requires that the fits file it ingests for the simulation match both PATTERN and NGroups, AND the Pattern must have GroupGap=0 (==> RAPID or BRIGHT1 for NIRCam).
Version 3: -------- Changes made to work with previously-tested OSS Target Acq Cases:
Observation 1 (SIR1 DR2): + Switched to NGroups=3, which is the OSS-tested case for SUBNDA210R subarray.
Observation 2 (SIR1): + Switched to MASKLWB, kept 'bright' TA target type. + Switched TA to NGroups=3, which is the OSS-tested case for SUBNDALWBL subarray. + Switched to 3-pt Bar dither, valid for the bar occulters.
Observation 12 (SIR1): + Switched from MASKLWB to M335R. Kept 'faint' TA target type. + Switched TA to NGroups=65, which is the OSS-tested case for SUBFSA335R subarray. + Switched to 5-pt Diamond dither pattern from 3-pt Bar (the latter isn't value for 'R' occulters). + Reduced the integration time a bit to compensate for additional dither positions.
Version 2: NOTE -- UPDATE NEEDED PRIOR TO EXECUTION: + This proposal will probably need to be updated to use a previously tested TA aperture + MASK combination, and NGroups in the TA exposure. + That will need to be done after a NIRCam/OSS meeting on 10/18, and prior to any observation being run on the OTB. + Those changes will not appreciably affect the execution time needed for the observations, so Version 2 is being submitted to support schedule planning.
1) Addded Guide star special requirement to use Guider 1 (forgot that in version 1).
2) Added an observation to run during dry-run 2 for SI Rehearsal 1: SIR-1 Dry-run 2: Observation 1 SIR-1 Real Thing: Observations 2, 12
Version 1: This is a short version of the coronagraphic TA checkout to be run on orbit. It is intended for execution in SI Rehearsal-1. It includes TA, astrometric images, and a short science exposure for 2 combinations of MASK and Bright/Faint target:
1) Bright, MASK210R, 5-pt box FSM dither pattern. F210M. 2) Faint, MASKLWB, 3-pt bar FSM dither pattern. F335M, F480M.
Full Commissioning Abstract (program 1075: ------------------------------------- This activity is a two-part test of NIRCam coronagraphic target acquisition (TA). Part 1 determines the precise offsets required to move a star from its measured position in the target-acquisition image to the ideal location behind each occulter. Part 2 follows the analysis period for Part 1 and tests the implementation of the derived offsets. Both parts follow the successful completion of CAR-NIRCAM-021b (Coronagraphic Astrometric Calibration), the goal of which is a geometric distortion map of the coronagraphic FOV with RMS errors less than 3 mas in each axis.
ProposalInformation.ExplainUnschedulable:
It isn't clear to me which observations are "unschedulable", but I suspect it is those that were already executed in the CPR2/3 rehearsal (#s 15 & 16).
The 3 observations being submitted for this rehearsal (19, 20, 21) ARE schedulable, so just ignore those that supposedly can't be scheduled.
ProposalInformation.ObservingDescription:
Part 1 is accomplished using dithered exposures of two single stars in the southern CVZ (one "bright" and one "faint", by NIRCam coronagraphic TA standards) positioned behind each of the 3 round occulting spots and at 2 positions along each of the 2 occulting bars defined by the shortest and longest bandpass filters supported for each bar. The exposure sequence for each bar is performed twice to verify that the same positions along the bar are achieved regardless of the order in which the filters are used.
During TA, the "bright" star is positioned behind one of the neutral density (ND) squares on the Coronagraph Optical Mount (COM) and the "faint" star is positioned in a clear region of the COM adjacent to an ND square. Before and after each slew to the nominal occulter position, a full-frame SCA exposure of the field is recorded to establish relative astrometry of the target and background stars. After the target star is positioned behind an occulter, the Fine Steering Mirror (FSM) is used to perform one of the following small grid dither (SGD) sequences:
Occulter type Bright star Faint star Spot 9-point circle 5-point diamond Bar 5-point line 3-point line
At each dither position, one or two 10-group integrations in RAPID mode (107 s) are recorded for the "bright" and "faint" targets, respectively, using the single, full-frame SCA appropriate for each occulter.
The sweet spot of each combination of star and occulter will be determined from the positions of the background stars and the symmetry of the occulted PSFs. An analysis period of 3 days is required to determine the sweet spots and derive any delta-corrections to the coronagraphic distortion solution from CAR-021b needed to move the target from the TA positions to the sweet spots within the nominal slew error of ~5 mas per axis. The revised offsets will then be added to the PRD (SIAF database) and updated on the observatory for implementation by the on-board coronagraphic TA scripts. It is not clear at this time how long it will take to update the on-board files and/or TA scripts, so we assume that an additional 4 days will be needed. Once the updates are complete, part 2 of this CAR can be executed.
The updated coronagraphic TA offsets are verified in Part 2 by repeating the observation sequences executed in Part 1, but with the number of FSM dither positions for the "bright" star reduced to match those of the "faint" star.

Target.Comments: "Bright" star (A0V, V= 5.690 +/- 0.009, V-K = -0.061 +/- 0.026) in the southern CVZ.
"Faint" star (A0V, V= 9.09 +/- 0.10, V-K = 0.28 +/- 0.10) in the southern CVZ.
"Faint" Spitzer-WISE photometric standard star (A0V, V = 12.42 +/- 0.23, V-K = 0.29 +/- 0.23) in the southern CVZ.

Observation.Label: #2_TAonOffset_Faint430R_SI-mini-1_OTB_20200817
Observation.Comments: Test using a nearby star as the 'science' target so that the calibration star ends up behind the COM, but hopefully not occulted by any mask, ND square, or the COM mount.
